an9.18:4.1: “Mendicants, the observance of the sabbath with its nine factors is very fruitful and beneficial and glorious and effective.
an9.18:4.2: And how should it be observed?
an9.18:4.3: It’s when a noble disciple reflects:
an9.18:4.4: ‘As long as they live the perfected ones give up killing living creatures, renouncing violence and harming. They are scrupulous and kind, and live full of compassion for all creatures.
an9.18:4.5: I, too, for this day and night will give up killing living creatures, renouncing violence and harming. I’ll be scrupulous and kind, and live full of compassion for all creatures.
an9.18:4.6: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’
an9.18:5.1: As long as they live the perfected ones give up high and luxurious beds. They sleep in a low place, either a small bed or a straw mat.
an9.18:5.3: I, too, for this day and night will give up high and luxurious beds. I’ll sleep in a low place, either a small bed or a straw mat.
an9.18:5.5: I will observe the sabbath by doing as the perfected ones do in this respect.’
an9.18:6.1: They meditate spreading a heart full of love to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth.
an9.18:6.2: In the same way they spread a heart full of love above, below, across, everywhere, all around—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.
an9.18:7.1: The observance of the sabbath with its nine factors in this way is very fruitful and beneficial and glorious and effective.”
